summary: This document is a FOIA request from a media company to the U.S. Attorney's Office, seeking audio, video, photographic, and transcript records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. It references two specific cases and lists categories of records including 911 calls, interviews with victims and witnesses, surveillance materials, and depositions.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as a defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330) and as a subject of the FOIA request for records including surveillance, interviews, and depositions.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to by initials 'JE' as a subject of the FOIA request for records including 911 calls, interviews with victims, and surveillance.

persons.name: Virginia L Giuffre
persons.context: Named as the plaintiff in the civil case Virginia L Giuffre v. Ghislaine Maxwell (15-cv-7433).

persons.name: Kevina Tidwell
persons.context: Appears in the document's subject line as the contact for the FOIA request regarding 'Blue Ant Studios'.

connections.description: Both are named together as subjects of the FOIA request for records related to victims, witnesses, surveillance, and investigations.
Giuffre is the plaintiff in a civil lawsuit against Maxwell, as referenced in the document.

events.title: FOIA Request for Epstein/Maxwell Records
events.description: A media company submits a FOIA request to the U.S. Attorney's Office seeking extensive audio, video, photographic, and transcript records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: The document is a FOIA request from a media company seeking public records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
It references two specific legal cases: the civil case 'Virginia L Giuffre v. Ghislaine Maxwell' (15-cv-7433) and the criminal case 'United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell' (20 Cr. 330).
The request seeks a wide range of materials including 911 calls, interviews with victims and witnesses, surveillance footage, and depositions involving Epstein and Maxwell.
The requester specifies they are entitled to 'public documents only', indicating the request is for non-sealed, publicly available records.
